00052 fsal_status_t FSAL_truncate(
00053     fsal_handle_t         * filehandle,         /* IN */
00054     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,          /* IN */
00055     fsal_size_t             length,             /* IN */
00056     fsal_file_t           * file_descriptor,    /* Unused in this FSAL */
00057     fsal_attrib_list_t    * object_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00058 ){
00059   
00060   int rc;
00061   u_signed64 trunc_size;
00062       
00063   /* sanity checks.
00064    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00065    */
00066   if ( !filehandle || !p_context )
00067     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00068     
00069   /* convert fsal_size_t to u_signed64 */
00070   
00071   trunc_size = fsal2hpss_64( length );
00072   
00073   /* check if it is a file */
00074   
00075   if ( filehandle->obj_type != FSAL_TYPE_FILE )
00076   {
00077     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00078   }
00079   
00080   /* Executes the HPSS truncate operation */
00081   
00082   TakeTokenFSCall();
00083   
00084   rc = hpss_TruncateHandle(
00085           &(filehandle->ns_handle),  /* IN - handle of file or parent */
00086           NULL,                      /* IN (handle addressing) */
00087           trunc_size,                /* IN - new file length */
00088          &(p_context->credential.hpss_usercred)      /* IN - pointer to user's credentials */
00089        );
00090 
00091   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00092   
00093   /* The HPSS_ENOENT error actually means that handle is STALE */
00094   if ( rc == HPSS_ENOENT )
00095     Return( ERR_FSAL_STALE, -rc, INDEX_FSAL_truncate );
00096   else if (rc)
00097     Return( hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_truncate );
00098 
00099   
00100   /* Optionnaly retrieve attributes */
00101   if( object_attributes ){
00102     
00103     fsal_status_t st;
00104         
00105     st = FSAL_getattrs( filehandle, p_context, object_attributes );
00106     
00107     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00108     {
00109       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00110       FSAL_SET_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00111           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00112     }
00113 
00114   }
00115   
00116   
00117   /* No error occured */
00118   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00119   
00120 }
